author: Fe Online
title: Odisha Administrative Services exams: Sanyasi Behera comes first among eight visually impaired candidates to clear exam - The Financial Express
text:
Odisha Administrative Services exams: Sanyasi Behera comes first among eight visually impaired candidates to clear exam Odisha Administrative Services exams: Sanyasi Behera comes first among eight visually impaired candidates to clear exam As the Odisha Public Service Commission (OPSC) declared its results for the Odisha Civil Services preliminary examination on February 17, Sanyasi Behera came first among the visually impaired candidates who qualified in the exams. By: FE Online | New Delhi | Published: February 21, 2017 9:01 PM Sanyasi Behera came first among the visually impaired candidates who qualified in the exams. (ANI) 
As the Odisha Public Service Commission (OPSC) declared its results for the Odisha Civil Services preliminary examination on February 17, Sanyasi Behera came first among the visually impaired candidates who qualified in the exams. Other than Sanyasi, eight other candidates qualified in the preliminary exams to make it to the final list. 
Delighted with the result, overwhelmed Sanyasi expressed his happiness and pride and stated that he had crossed all attitudinal and legal barriers to clear the exam and participate in the decission making process. Sanyasi got an all Odisha rank of 20 in the exams. 
Also Watch: 
As reported by The Indian Express, Sanyasi was given a scribe to write the exam and he claimed that there was also a special invigilator to ensure that whatever he dictates is written. 
However, the Commission had clarified that based on two relevant cases pending in the State Administrative Tribunal (SAT), the results of ex-servicemen and selected SEBC candidates will be decided. Results of three other candidates permitted to attend the exams by the High Court have been kept in hold for the final decision of similar cases pending in SAT.
